messages.content: What is the training orientation of the CSE program at VNUK?
The CSE program combines three tracks—application, research, and business—helping students adapt flexibly to diverse career environments.
What are the main objectives of the CSE program?
The major aims to build a solid computer science foundation, develop technical and communication skills, and foster responsibility, proactiveness, and lifelong learning.
What teaching language does the CSE program use?
All courses in the specialization are delivered entirely in English.
How long does the CSE program at VNUK last?
The program spans four academic years plus an additional half year of intensive internship.
How many credits must CSE students earn to complete the program?
Students must complete 152 credits counted toward graduation; total credits including electives and non-graded courses can reach up to 210.
How is the CSE program structured?
The program is divided into general education, foundational courses, specialized courses, skills and internship, and a non-graded physical component.
What is the English name of Computer Science Engineering?
The official English name is Computer Science Engineering.
What soft-skill goals does the CSE program aim for?
The program emphasizes communication, teamwork, design thinking, and personal planning skills in an international context.
Why does VNUK emphasize English-medium instruction in CSE?
Because VNUK follows international standards, enabling students to integrate globally and access new knowledge faster.
What are the highlights of the CSE program at VNUK?
Highlights include the international curriculum, English-medium teaching, a 6-month internship, and a blended academic–industry–innovation focus.
How many credits are in the CSE general education block?
The general education block totals 15 credits covering political theory and social foundations.
Is there a law course in the general education group?
Yes, General Law is included with 2 credits.
Does the program include a Global Culture course?
Yes, the Global Culture course is in the general education group to broaden cultural awareness.
Which Marxist Leninist theory courses are included?
It includes philosophy, political economy, scientific socialism, Ho Chi Minh thought, and Party history.
Do CSE students have to take Party History?
Yes, it is a mandatory 2-credit course in general education.
What are the key foundational courses in CSE?
Key courses include introductory programming, basic Java, operating systems, data structures and algorithms, systems analysis, and database design.
How many credits are in the core portion of the major?
The foundational and core group totals 60 credits.
How many credits is the OOP course?
Object-Oriented Programming carries 5 credits and is a core course.
How many operating systems courses do students take?
There are two courses: Introduction to Operating System (2 credits) and an advanced Operating System course (5 credits).
Is there a course on networking and concurrency?
Yes, the Networking and Concurrency course covers computer networks and concurrent processing.
Does the program teach AI?
Yes, Artificial Intelligence is a 5-credit course in the extended foundational block.
Is there a cryptography course in CSE?
Yes, the 3-credit Cryptography course introduces encryption and security techniques.
What are the key points of the CSE program at VNUK?
The CSE pathway focuses on training engineers to international standards, equipping scientific-technical foundations, soft skills, and self-learning ability to meet domestic and global demand.
What training goals does the CSE major target?
The program aims to develop a solid computer science base, strengthen professional and communication skills, and build responsibility and professionalism.
How many total credits are required to graduate?
Students must earn at least 152 graded credits to graduate.
Which language of instruction does CSE at VNUK use?
The entire program is delivered in English.
How long does the course last?
The formal study lasts four years plus a six-month final internship.
Which courses are included in the general education component?
Foundational courses include philosophy, political economy, scientific socialism, Party history, Ho Chi Minh thought, general law, and global culture.
How many credits are in the general education component?
The general knowledge component totals 15 credits.
Which core foundational courses are in the CSE curriculum?

Core foundational courses cover basic programming, Java, operating systems, OOP, systems analysis and data design, math for programming, networking and concurrency, data structures, AI, big data, cryptography, and others.
How many credits are in the foundational knowledge block of the major?
The foundational knowledge block of the major accounts for 60 credits.
What does the specialized knowledge block of CSE cover?
Specialized courses span advanced web development, mobile programming, software testing, information security, IoT, personal projects, project management, game development, 3D, and the capstone.
How many credits are in the specialized block?
The specialized block totals 83 credits.
What soft skills are included in the program?
Students train in academic skills, communication, applied informatics, design thinking, participate in technical projects, plus a 10-credit internship.
How many credits cover soft skills and internship?
Soft skills and internship together make up 27 credits.
How is the physical education component counted?
There are four sports courses totaling 4 credits, not counted in GPA.
How many credits are in the English program?
The academic English system has 21 credits including Writing, EAP 1-3, and English for IT.
What do first-year students study?
First year focuses on introductory programming, academic English, study skills, basic informatics, and some general and industry foundation courses.
What do students study in the second year?
Second year centers on systems analysis, computer math, OOP, application development, data structures and algorithms, web, mobile, networking and concurrency, and political theory courses.
What do students study in the third year?
Third year includes elective specialized courses, remaining political theory courses, and a long-term professional internship.
What are the main contents in the final year?
The final stage covers artificial intelligence, elective specialized courses, and the graduation thesis.
What are the graduate outcomes for professional skills?
Graduates must work professionally, handle problems in economic-technical contexts, think critically, innovate, and uphold professional ethics.
What is the English requirement for graduation?
Students need B2 level English, equivalent to IELTS 6.0 or higher.
What criteria are required for graduation recognition?

To be eligible for graduation, students must complete required credits, achieve a minimum GPA of 2.0, fulfill tuition obligations, meet English standards, finish national defense–security education, and not violate regulations.
What jobs can CSE graduates pursue?
Graduates can work in software development, systems analysis, information system maintenance, research, teaching, or large-scale tech projects.
What is the current income advantage in the tech industry?
IT salaries in Vietnam often range from 20-30 million VND per month, and strong English speakers can earn above 1,000 USD at international firms.
What is EFU and who is it for?
EFU is a preparatory English program for students below the language requirement, boosting their foundation before studying in English.
What is the main objective of the EFU program?
EFU aims to help students reach IELTS 6.5 equivalence, master academic skills, and communicate confidently in an international learning environment.
Who must take the English placement test at VNUK?
All students without IELTS or with scores below 4.5 must take the placement test.
What score allows a student to skip EFU?
Students with IELTS 4.5 or higher go directly to the Foundation stage without EFU.
How are the levels in VNUK's English placement test classified?
Levels range from Basic English 1 to EAP 3, spanning scores 80-170 and mapping from Pre A1 up to IELTS 6.0 equivalence.
How do EAP 1, 2, and 3 differ?
EAP 1 builds academic writing and reading; EAP 2 focuses on reports and document analysis; EAP 3 completes comprehensive academic skills to international standards.
What distinguishes the CSE program at VNUK?
It is a state-supported, high-quality bachelor program aligned with international education standards.
What career readiness does CSE at VNUK focus on?
It trains computer scientists and engineers with strong technical foundations, soft skills, and lifelong learning habits for domestic and global markets.
How does the program balance application, research, and business?
The curriculum intentionally blends application projects, research exposure, and business-oriented thinking to keep graduates versatile.
What are the total graduation credits for CSE?
Students need 152 credits to graduate, within an overall plan of up to 210 credits including electives and non-graded courses.
What is the language of instruction for CSE?
English is the language of instruction across the CSE curriculum.
How long is the CSE study duration including internship?
It spans four academic years plus a six-month final internship.
What are the five main curriculum components?
They include general education, foundational and core courses, specialized courses, soft skills with internship, and non-graded physical education.
Which component is non-graded?
The physical education component is non-graded and not counted in GPA.
How are credits distributed across knowledge segments?
General knowledge has 41 credits, foundational 31, specialized 60, and internship plus thesis 20, totaling 152 graduation credits.
What is the combined credit plan including electives?
The plan can reach 210 credits when electives and non-graded courses are included.
What do students study in year one of CSE?
Year one covers introductory programming, academic English, study skills, applied computer skills, and selected general and industry foundation modules.
What is emphasized in year two of CSE?
Year two emphasizes systems analysis, computer math, OOP, application development, data structures, web and mobile development, networking and concurrency, plus political theory courses.
What happens in year three of CSE?
Year three includes specialized electives, remaining political theory courses, and a long professional internship.
What do students complete in the final year?
The final year features artificial intelligence, additional specialized electives, and the graduation thesis.
When is the six-month internship scheduled?
The extended internship takes place in the third year as part of professional training.
What major project occurs at the end of the program?
Students complete a Graduation Project worth 10 credits in the specialized block.
What professional behaviors are expected of graduates?
Graduates are expected to work professionally, communicate effectively, and collaborate across IT contexts.
How should graduates handle complex problems?
They should solve complex issues within economic, political, social, and legal contexts using IT and related disciplines.
What ethical standards are highlighted?
The program stresses integrity, critical thinking, innovation, and professional ethics and responsibility.
What English level must graduates reach?
Graduates must reach B2 equivalence, about IELTS 6.0 or higher.
What GPA is required for graduation?
A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 is required.
Which compliance items are needed before graduation?
Students must complete credits, meet English standards, finish physical and defense education, and clear tuition with no disciplinary violations.
Who should join the English for University Programme (EFU)?
Students who have not met the required English proficiency join EFU for foundational language training.
What is the goal of EFU?
EFU aims to raise students to around IELTS 6.5 equivalence with strong academic English skills.
What score range corresponds to Basic English 1?
Placement scores 80–99 place students into Basic English 1.
What is the IELTS equivalent for Basic English 2?
Basic English 2 corresponds to roughly IELTS 3.0.
What does Pre-sessional 1 focus on?
Pre-sessional 1 builds basic academic reading and writing and introduces university learning styles.
What is the score range for Pre-sessional 2?
Scores 130–139 place students into Pre-sessional 2, about IELTS 4.0.
What is the focus of Pre-sessional 3?
Pre-sessional 3 prepares students for EAP with advanced academic skills and transitions around IELTS 4.5.
What score range maps to EAP 1?
Scores 147–159 align to EAP 1, roughly IELTS 5.0.
What score range maps to EAP 2?
Scores 160–170 map to EAP 2, around IELTS 5.5.
What is the IELTS equivalent for EAP 3?
EAP 3 is equivalent to about IELTS 6.0.
Who is exempt from EAP courses?
Students with IELTS 6.5 or higher are exempt from EAP courses.
How many credits are allocated to internship and thesis?
Internship and thesis together account for 20 credits in the graduation plan.
How many credits are allocated to general knowledge electives?
General knowledge and electives together form part of the 41-credit common knowledge segment.
What is the credit load for foundational industry knowledge?
Industry foundation modules contribute to the 31 credits in the foundational segment.
How many specialized credits must be completed?
Students complete 60 credits of specialized knowledge modules.
How many credits are tied to the graduation project alone?
The Graduation Project is a 10-credit capstone course.
What is the aim of Object Oriented Programming in the curriculum?
It builds abstraction, encapsulation, inheritance, and design skills crucial for later development courses.
Why is Networking and Concurrency included?
It prepares students for distributed systems and parallel processing challenges in modern computing.
What skills does Math for Computer Programming reinforce?
It strengthens mathematical reasoning used in algorithms, data structures, and software analysis.
How does Software Engineering and HCI support students?
It blends engineering process knowledge with user-centered design to create usable systems.
What is the purpose of System Analysis and Database Design?
It trains students to model requirements and architect data solutions for information systems.
Why does CSE include Cryptography?
Cryptography introduces security principles needed for protecting data and communications.
How do Advanced Web courses extend basic web design?
They dive deeper into complex front-end and back-end techniques, scaling, and modern frameworks.
What outcomes come from the Mobile Design and Development course?
Students learn to architect, build, and deploy mobile apps across platforms with good UI/UX practices.
What practical experience does the Individual Project provide?
It lets students design and deliver a personal software project, applying accumulated skills.
What does Development and Operations teach?
It introduces DevOps practices such as CI/CD, automation, and deployment pipelines.
Why are communication skills included in CSE?
They enable students to present ideas, collaborate effectively, and work in diverse teams.
What does Personal Development Planning help students achieve?
It guides students to set goals, plan careers, and manage their own professional growth.
How does Design Thinking benefit CSE students?
It fosters empathy, ideation, prototyping, and iterative problem-solving for user-centered solutions.
What is the aim of System Engineering Projects?
They let students practice engineering processes from requirements to delivery in team settings.
Why is the 10-credit internship significant?
It immerses students in professional environments, bridging academic learning with industry practice.
What is the role of Physical Education in the program?
It supports student wellness and balance, though it is non-graded and outside GPA calculations.
How many physical education modules must students complete?
Students complete four non-graded PE modules.
Why is Academic Writing required?
It builds formal writing skills essential for reports, research, and thesis work.
What is the progression of EAP courses?
EAP 1 builds academic foundations, EAP 2 advances reporting and analysis, and EAP 3 finalizes readiness for full English-medium study.
What happens if a student scores below IELTS 4.5?
They take the placement test and follow the appropriate EFU or Basic/Pre-sessional track before main studies.
Can students with IELTS 5.5 join EAP 2 directly?
Yes, an IELTS-equivalent of 5.5 aligns with EAP 2 placement.
Why does VNUK require a placement test?
To place students into the correct English level ensuring they can succeed in an English-medium program.
What salary range is typical for IT roles in Vietnam?
Many IT roles range from 20 to 30 million VND per month, with higher pay for strong English skills.
How does English proficiency affect salary prospects?
Strong English can lead to salaries above 1,000 USD at international companies.
Which regions benefit from VNUK-trained IT talent?
The program supports Central Vietnam and broader markets needing skilled software professionals.
What core competencies should CSE graduates demonstrate?
They should design, implement, and maintain IT systems, plan projects, and communicate solutions effectively.
What industries can CSE graduates enter?
Graduates can work in software development, system analysis, IT consulting, research, education, and large tech projects.
How does the program prepare students for research?
Through foundational theory, applied projects, and a capstone that can include research-oriented topics.
How does the program support lifelong learning?
It builds habits of self-study, critical thinking, and continuous upskilling through projects and reflection.
How is business orientation reflected in CSE?
Courses like project management, best practices, and industry-focused modules embed business and process understanding.
What international standards influence CSE design?
The curriculum aligns with global CS engineering expectations and English-medium delivery to match international benchmarks.
What happens if tuition is unpaid before graduation?
Students must clear all tuition obligations to be eligible for graduation recognition.
Are there disciplinary requirements for graduation?
Yes, students must not be under disciplinary action or legal violation at the time of graduation review.
Why include national defense and security education?
It is a mandatory requirement for graduation as regulated by VNUK and national policy.
How many credits are tied to general knowledge and electives combined?
Together they sum to 41 credits of common knowledge requirements.
How many credits are allocated to specialized knowledge alone?
Specialized knowledge accounts for 60 credits within the major.
What is the credit load of the internship course?
The internship course carries 10 credits and sits in the Soft Skills & Internship component.
How are electives integrated across years?
Electives appear in general knowledge, industry foundation, and specialized selections, allowing customization each year.
How does the program use English in class activities?
Lectures, assignments, presentations, and projects are conducted in English to build fluency.
How is teamwork emphasized in CSE?
Group projects, system engineering projects, and the internship require collaborative planning and delivery.
What types of assessments are common?
Assessments include assignments, projects, presentations, exams, and capstone evaluations.
How does the curriculum encourage innovation?
Through design thinking, project-based learning, and exposure to emerging topics like AI, IoT, and security.
How are students prepared for the internship?
Pre-internship courses in skills, communication, and project practice ready students for workplace expectations.
What support helps students reach IELTS 6.0+?
Layered English courses from Academic Writing through EAP 3 build the proficiency needed for graduation standards.
How does the program address software quality?
Courses like Testing and Reliable Software and Best Practices teach quality assurance and reliable delivery.
What is expected in the Graduation Project?
Students must propose, design, implement, and defend a substantial software or system solution worth 10 credits.
Can the Graduation Project be research-oriented?
Yes, students may choose research-focused topics aligned with faculty guidance.
How is the Graduation Project assessed?
Assessment typically includes proposal, implementation, documentation, presentation, and defense.
What duration is the professional internship?
It is typically a six-month engagement counted as a 10-credit course.
What outcomes are expected from the internship?
Students gain practical experience, apply academic knowledge, and build professional networks.
Can internship performance affect graduation?
Yes, successful completion and evaluation of the internship are required for graduation credits.
How many total courses cover physical education?
Four distinct courses cover physical education requirements.
Which course introduces DevOps concepts?
Development and Operations introduces CI/CD and deployment practices.
Which course focuses on security beyond cryptography?
Information Security covers broader security practices, while Cryptography tackles encryption fundamentals.
Which course addresses big data topics?
Big Data Analysis introduces large-scale data processing and analytics concepts.
Which course blends human factors with software engineering?
Software Engineering and Human Computer Interaction integrates engineering processes with user experience design.
What happens if a student already holds IELTS 7.0?
They are exempt from EFU and EAP courses and can proceed directly to academic modules.
Can students retake the placement test?
Policies vary, but placement aims to accurately match students to the correct English level for success.
How many total credits are non-graded?
The four physical education courses total 4 non-graded credits not counted toward GPA.
How many graded credits are required for graduation?
Students must complete 152 graded credits to meet graduation requirements.
What is the course code for Philosophy of Marxism and Leninism?
The course code is BEB23122, worth 3 credits.

The course code is BEB32123, worth 2 credits.

What is the minimum credit requirement for graduation?
Students need 152 credits to graduate, though the total program can include up to 210 credits with electives and non-graded courses.
How many credits are in the general knowledge segment?
The general knowledge segment totals 41 credits.
How many credits are in the foundational segment?
The foundational segment totals 31 credits.
How many credits are in the specialized segment?
The specialized segment totals 60 credits.
How many credits are allocated to internship and thesis?
Internship and thesis together account for 20 credits.
